      • REPLACE_MOST_DISSIMILAR_MODEL

        public static final String REPLACE_MOST_DISSIMILAR_MODEL
        Use this String at setUpdateMode(String) for replacing the most dissimilar model compared to the new model. Squared distance is used to determine similarity.
        See Also:

        Use this String at setUpdateMode(String) for replacing a random model.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REPLACE_SAMPLED_MOST_DISSIMILAR_MODEL

        public static final String REPLACE_SAMPLED_MOST_DISSIMILAR_MODEL
        Use this String at setUpdateMode(String) for using a sample of the stream to determine which model of the ensemble will be replaced. The sample is used to create quantiles of parts of the stream that are handled in different chunks. You can set the sample rate with #setSampleRatio(double). The similarity is computed by squared distance.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MERGE_OLDEST_MODELS

        public static final String MERGE_OLDEST_MODELS
        use this String at setUpdateMode(String) for merging the eldest and second eldest model in order to decrease the ensemble size by one.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MERGE_MOST_SIMILAR_MODELS

        public static final String MERGE_MOST_SIMILAR_MODELS
        use this String at setUpdateMode(String) for merging the most similar models of the ensemble instead of deleting one. Similarity is defined by squared distance.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MERGE_MOST_DISSIMILAR_MODELS

        public static final String MERGE_MOST_DISSIMILAR_MODELS
        use this String at setUpdateMode(String) for merging the most dissimilar models of the ensemble. Similarity is defined by squared distance.
        See Also:

      • getUpdateMode

        public String getUpdateMode()
        Returns the currently used update mode
        Returns:
        a String that contains the classifier of the current update mode

      • setUpdateMode

        public void setUpdateMode(String um)
        Use this method to change the default kind of update (i.e. replacing the model with greatest squared distance to the new model). There are seven different kinds of updating the ensemble (represented by final static Strings):
        • REPLACE_MOST_DISSIMILAR_MODEL: determining which model has furthest squared distance to the new one and replacing it (default)
        • REPLACE_OLDEST_MODEL: replacing the oldest value
        • REPLACE_RANDOM_MODEL: replacing a random model
        • REPLACE_SAMPLED_MOST_DISSIMILAR_MODEL: sampling the stream to get a reference model that contains elements that are handled in different chunks. again the squared distance is used to determine which model will be replaced
        • MERGE_OLDEST_MODELS: merging the oldest model to decrease the number of models of the ensemble
        • MERGE_MOST_SIMILAR_MODELS: merging the most similar models in respect to squared distance
        • MERGE_MOST_DISSIMILAR_MODELS: merging the most dissimilar models in respect to squared distance
        Parameters:
        updateMode - Please use final static strings listed above to enable an update mode.

      • getSampleRatio

        public double getSampleRatio()
        Returns current sample rate
        Returns:
        double value specifying the current sample rate.

      • setSampleRatio

        public void setSampleRatio(Double sampleRatio)
        Specify a Double value to set the sampling rate. Please note that a sample rate of 0 will result in no sampling, so each time the reference vector will be the new model. If you set the sample rate to a value greater or equal to 1 the elements will rather be saved than sampled.
        Parameters:
        sampleRatio -
